content.description:
Fight the bushes to get on the wall, come into the first bolt from the right. Angle slightly left and cross the bolt line to gain the flake. Enjoy good holds to the second bolt, and then be prepped for thin slab! 

Bring your foot work, balance and trust are required! Head hard left at bolt 5 and traverse on big holds to the anchor. 

Consider stick clipping. 



Locate the low roof (the path goes directly under this roof) on The Fortress. Follow this to the right end. "By Stealth" goes up the first panel of rock just right of the roof, and arcs left under the prominent roof at ~12 m that sweeps into a right facing corner.  

5 bolts, chain anchor

Crux at the second clip.

To the right of Winston's Choice (5.11b) on the Big Wall of the Fortress at Skaha Bluffs. Obvious big holds on a roof marks the start of the route.
4 bolts with anchor finish. Leads into the second pitch of Mortal Combat, which is rated a 5.12a.

Shares the anchor with Besieged Briefly.

Just to the right of Besieged - look for an old piton above the first bolt
4 bolts and cracks to place gear.

Approach by "Fearful in Battle" (trad, 11b) or "By Stealth" (sport, 11a. Back clean bolts 1,2, long draw 2,3, skip 5). From the chain anchor, choose the bolt line that arcs left, straightens out, and then joins a plum anchor. 

Easy climbing at first leads you to thin, tenuous climbing. Several bolt to bolt sequences are in the 11+ to 12b range, but it is slab so you can sort of rest anywhere. The crux is tightly bolted and involves a non-existent left foot and two right hand Gaston's, good luck!

For full value, link in to "Disembowelled" (12a, 7 bolts, 20 m) - the bolt line exiting the 2nd anchor. 

The top anchor is the old fat Metolius hangers with a pair of biners. Because of the way the biners sit, your rope gets twisted pretty fiercely. A quick-link between the hanger and the biner would fix this, if you have the means!



Locate the low roof (the path goes directly under this roof) on The Fortress. Follow this to the end. "By Stealth" goes up the first panel of rock just right of the roof, and arcs left under the prominent roof at ~12 m that sweeps into a right facing corner. This bolt line, or the faint crack ~3 m to the left are your approach options. Belay in the bushes just left of the trees. 

For P2 only, 10 bolts. Both anchors are fixed.

Difficult climbing through the black streak, moving towards the bottom of the second dihedral before stepping right onto the face. Continue with holds decreasing in size and moves increasing in difficulty.

The bolted route starting in the left-centre of the huge roof.
11 bolts
A collection of quality routes ranging from 10b to 12b, many of which are two pitches in length.
